SOOOO basically it is saying you cant have two faces using the same UV unwrap point?

No, it's saying you have multiple materials on the same object from merging separate objects. You need to remove all materials from the object and add a new one. Sometimes this works and sometimes it doesn't and they still show up in unity anyway. If that happens export the mesh as an fbx file, re-import into your 3d modeler, delete the materials and make new ones and it should be fixed.

I went freaking nuts over trying to sort this out for some of my meshes. It's not multiple materials so much as mucked up UVs. And it's not clear in Blender how to remove a UV properly. If you select the mesh, and in the properties tabs, select the "Object" properties (the one that's a triangle with solid vertices), there's a list of UV maps there. Remove them all with the minus button and then re-unwrap for the whole mesh at once.
